For Re at 6 keV, it shifts the center of the final-state sphere transversally by more than a full BZ [see lower inset in Fig. 6( a) ▸]. This rigid shift of the final-state sphere with radius k f leads to a significant dissymmetry in the observed photoemission patterns as illustrated by the top insets in Fig. 6( a) ▸.
